intro: Hippocratea rubiginosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hippocratea, is a species native to parts of Central America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture.
